unnormalised: School exams, eh? Remember those days? The stress, the anxiety, the late-night study sessions fuelled by endless cups of chai. Good times, good times. Or maybe not so good. But anyway, it’s exam season again, so let's talk about those dreaded school exams.
normalised: School exams, eh? Remember those days? The stress, the anxiety, the late-night study sessions fueled by endless cups of chai. Good times, good times. Or maybe not so good. But anyway, it’s exam season again, so let's talk about those dreaded school exams.

unnormalised: First up, the biggies – your Class 10 and Class 12 board exams. These exams, usually conducted by CBSE or your respective state board (like Maharashtra State Board), hold a lot of weight, especially for future college admissions. Scoring well, say above 90%, is often considered a must for entry into top colleges like IIT. But hey, don’t sweat it too much! There's more to life than just marks. I got only 75% in my Class 12 but I still got into a decent college!
normalised: First up, the biggies – your Class ten and Class twelve board exams. These exams, usually conducted by C-B-S-E or your respective state board (like Maharashtra State Board), hold a lot of weight, especially for future college admissions. Scoring well, say above ninety percent, is often considered a must for entry into top colleges like I-I-T. But hey, don’t sweat it too much! There's more to life than just marks. I got only seventy five percent in my Class twelve but I still got into a decent college!

unnormalised: Then you have your regular school exams - the half-yearly, quarterly, and annual exams. These are more like practice runs for the boards, and your teachers use them to gauge your understanding of the subjects. Often they carry weightage of like 30% to your final grade. Your performance in these exams is a continuous assessment of your learning. So try to take them seriously! My little brother prepares for these with notes from Byju's.

unnormalised: Let's talk about the stress factor. Exam stress is a real thing, guys. The pressure to perform well can be intense, especially when parents and teachers are constantly pushing you. It’s important to find healthy ways to manage stress. Take breaks, get some exercise, talk to your friends or family, and don’t forget to sleep! I recall having a breakdown before my physics exam!

unnormalised: And then there are the competitive exams – JEE, NEET, CLAT, and so on. These are whole different ball game altogether! Preparing for these requires dedication, discipline, and a lot of hard work. Some students start preparing from Class 11 itself! And the coaching centers charge almost Rs. 2,00,000!

unnormalised: What subjects? Well that depends on what stream you're taking, of course. If you're going into science you'll be studying Physics, Chemistry, Maths, Biology, and maybe Computer Science. If it's Commerce, then Economics, Accountancy, Business Studies and Maths (sometimes) is likely. Arts has a whole host of options like History, Geography, Sociology, Political Science, English Literature, Hindi, and many other languages.

unnormalised: So, what is the goal of examinations? They're meant to assess what you've learned and how well you can apply that knowledge. However, try not to define yourself only by your exam scores. You are capable of so many things! Whether you score a 99/100, 75% or 60% (or even less), remember your worth doesn't depend on the exam! Keep prepping and all the best for your exams!
